purpose: Provide clear and enforceable rules that govern how runtime components operate within WyneOS.

normal.description: The system is stable and all engines may run within their defined limits.

controlled.description: Restricted mode used when anomalies or partial failures occur.

critical.description: Emergency mode triggered by integrity breach or invalid manifest.

runtimeRules.sealRequirement: No engine may run unless all seals from Phase 0 to Phase 9 are valid.
runtimeRules.manifestRequirement: All manifests must be present and verified before loading any engine.
runtimeRules.telemetryRequirement: Telemetry must be current and readable before any decision pathway is executed.
runtimeRules.sandboxing: Engines operate in isolated execution boundaries with restricted access to system files.

prohibitedBehaviour.unauthorisedScripts: No script outside the runtime or engine directories may execute.
prohibitedBehaviour.selfModification: Engines must not write to their own code or manifests.
prohibitedBehaviour.externalExecution: No external processes may be launched without governance approval.

summary.statement: This policy defines what is and is not allowed during execution. All runtime components must comply with this document as a condition of operation.
